node.TEXT: Politics where anger, threats, and polarization from any side don’t overpower civil discourse. Pragmatism and compromise are accepted for governing responsibly and benefiting everyone equitably.
Electorate lacking in sufficient knowledge and experience concerning civic life
Lacking sufficient current information about voting and civic and political life from a local lens.
Lacking personal experience participating in local politics such as participating on a zoning board, hearing and decisions of local government, etc.
Lacking educational background and upbringing in civics, critical thinking, media literacy, and rational debate
Civics
Fulfill promise of bill of rights and Magna Carta
Institutionalize society that has as rule 1 equity for everyone "liberal democracy""

Political System Structural Tendency to Extremes
Gerrymandering balkanizes into silos and distorts representation
Direct primaries attract more extreme voters
First-past-post electoral system incentivizes extremes
Winner-take-all electoral college voting can disregard up to nearly half of state voters' will in the worst case.
Social Media's Polarizing Role in the Public Square
Algorithms incentivize extremes
Algorithms incentivize emotion compared with slow, deliberated reasoning
Boring truth dies on social media, while a sensational lie while a sensational lie goes viral and over time become a half-truth.
Actors intentionally perpetuating polarization because they benefit from it
Geo-political actors benefitting from a degradation of US democracy
"Outrage Industrial Complex"
Individual incentive to divide for career, wealth, fame, and power
Corporate incentive to polarize for profit, audience, and reputation
Firehood of falsehood communication model can be very effective

Federal Government dysfunction leaves both Left and Right feeling betrayed
Tactics used by politicians: If one party throws sand in the gears and stuff doesn't work, the average citizen doesn't really know why it's not working, so blames the majority party.
Cynicism: Governmental "gridlock and dysfunction is a recipe for growing cynicism among the electorate that further polarizes folks." Barack Obama
Splintered Media Landscape is no longer the three TV channels the US populace used to get its news from, reducing the common baseline of facts
